intro: Chloraea campestris, commonly known as the field chloraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chloraea campestris is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
